Incident.Summary: 6/3/23: Report of harassment/assault at 79 W Frederick St Walkersville

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
*Maryland State Police Frederick Barrack*
Vehicle: Blue Unmarked Ford Explorer B-69
Body Camera Equipped and Functioning: No, due to nature of call occurring over phone
In-car Camera Equipped and Functioning: No, due to nature of call

ATTACHMENTS:
Photos of BRENDA injury

COMPLAINANT:
BRENDA JEAN WIEDER 10/9/56
STATEMENT:
(Phone interview)
BRENDA stated she was at the craft fair in Walkersville around noon when she observed her estranged daughter-in-law  RAQUEL WIEDER, selling candles at a table at the event. BRENDA stated that it had been years since they last spoke/saw each other after a falling out. BRENDA stated that she felt because she was now seeing her, she should say hello. BRENDA stated that RAQUEL immediately began to yell at her and tell BRENDA to leave. BRENDA stated that she picked up a candle at the table and asked if RAQUEL wasn't going to allow her to buy the candle. BRENDA stated that RAQUEL stated no. BRENDA admitted that she said "Well, Ill just steal the candle since no one does anything to anyone anyway as long as it's less than $900". BRENDA stated that RAQUEL than grabbed her wrist in order to get the candle out of her hand. BRENDA stated she attempted to talk to RAQUEL another time and even another person at a table at the event told her to stop bothering RAQUEL.

BRENDA stated that it wasn't until she got home later in the afternoon, that she observed the injury to her wrist that she believes RAQUEL had caused (See Attachments).

BRENDA also went on to provide additional backstory as to the falling out between herself and her daughter-in-law. BRENDA also stated she suffers from PTSD and the stress of these arguments in the past has caused her to feel suicidal. When asked if this current event was causing her to want to hurt herself, BRENDA stated "no".

SUSPECT:
RAQUEL SEGARRA WIEDER 9/7/81
See TFC Ingrams report (Ref 23-MSP-019917) for RAQUEL statement in reference to this event.

NARRATIVE:
On 6/3/23 at approximately 1551 hours, I, TFC Meyers, was advised by dispatch to contact a caller no longer in the county who wished to report an assault that had occurred earlier in the day in Walkersville. I then made contact with the complainant, BRENDA JEAN WIEDER, who provided the above statement over the phone. I also instructed WIEDER to take photos of her injuries and email them to me (See Attachments). BRENDA was provided the case number and information on filing for charges if she wished to do so and provided information on peace/protective orders as well. BRENDA stated that she would be traveling up to the Frederick County Commissioners Office after our phone call to file for charges. BRENDA was also instructed that if/when she does visit Walkersville, protective order or not, to avoid contact with her daughter-in-law and ignore her.

It was shortly after I spoke with BRENDA and ended my shift for that day, I observed that TFC Ingram had been dispatched to the address of BRENDA'S son and daughter-in-law, who wished to report a similar report of harassment in regard to the event that BRENDA had contacted me about. (Ref 23-MSP-019917). They were provided similar information as I had provided BRENDA.

All above events occurred in Frederick County, MD.

I request this case be closed, victim referred to commissioners office for charges/peace order.
